Title: Net Pad
Description: GTalk and Facebook chat application written in C++ with wxWidgets as the UI toolkit.
HomeWiki:
Netpad (work in progress) is an XMPP based, IM and presence application written in C++ with wxWidgets as the UI toolkit. 

Some features, as of this writing:

  1. Supports GTalk and Facebook chat. Allows login to Google and Facebook at the same time if credentials for both services are same. Both, Gtalk and Facebook contacts are shown in single list view.
  2. Supports upto 64, concurrent and different, GTalk and/or Facebook IM sessions in a single application instance
  3. Shows contact's bare jid (jabber ID), suggesting type of client the user is logged in from. Facebook contacts are all marked with a blue "F" 
  4. Allows user to tag specific contacts or the entire roster for status change alerts.
  5. Ability to set autoreply across the entire roster as well as on a per contact basis.
  6. google:shared-status compatible. Supports invisibility and the ability to explicitly set status as Away. Facebook chat doesnt support arbitrary client presence packets hence you're always online on FB
